avalancheActivity.comment:
Wind slabs can sometimes be released by a single winter sport participant. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain above approximately 2000 m and in places that are protected from the wind. Especially at intermediate and high altitudes these avalanche prone locations are more widespread.
The more recent wind slabs are in many cases extensive. They are quite prevalent and are clearly recognisable to the trained eye, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The strong wind has transported the new snow. The weather conditions gave rise to unfavourable bonding of the snowpack in some places. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released, especially at their margins. This applies in particular on very steep slopes. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Individual weak layers exist in the old snowpack. These avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable, even to the trained eye, caution is to be exercised in particular in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow,, this also applies in places that are protected from the wind, this also applies in little used backcountry terrain.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack especially on shady slopes. Whumpfing sounds and shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack are a clear indication.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: The sometimes strong wind will transport only a little snow. In particular at intermediate and high altitudes rather small wind slabs formed. Caution is to be exercised on extremely steep slopes, especially at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 2 (moderate). In these regions the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in extremely steep terrain at intermediate and high altitudes.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
